de.braintags.netrelay.controller.impl.authentication

Class PasswordLostController

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.braintags.netrelay.controller.impl.AbstractController
      • de.braintags.netrelay.controller.impl.authentication.PasswordLostController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.braintags.netrelay.controller.IController, io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext>

    public class PasswordLostController
extends de.braintags.netrelay.controller.impl.AbstractController
    The PasswordLostController is used to manage the process for a user, if he lost his password.
    The entry is an http-form, which you will create and which contains a field to enter an email address. The name of this field must be the same, like you defined in the controller properties with the property "emailFieldName", which by default is "email". The destination of the form must be a route, which is covered by the current controller ( for instance /customer/passwordLost ).
    The controller knows two actions:
    - the start of the password lost process
    where a user filled out a the email address and sends the form. The start of the password lost is activated, when the request contains a form parameter "emailFieldName"
    - the confirmation of a password lost
    which is typically performed when a user clicked a link in a confirmation mail and is activated, when the request contains the parameter "validationId"
    If none of this fits, then the controller will throw an exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: invalid action for password lost process


    At first, for the reset process, the system chechs the existence of an account for the given email address. If found, the controller creates a new instance of PasswordLostClaim, which contains all needed data to finish the process in step 2. Previously created instances of PasswordLostClaim with the same email address are deactivated.
    The id of the PasswordLostClaim is stored in the context under the property "validationId", additionally the PasswordLostClaim itself is stored inside the context under "PasswordLostClaim". Further the email address of the found Member etc. is stored in the context under the parameter MailController.TO_PARAMETER, so that the MailController can use it later on to send the message. Additionally all request parameters are added to the context, so that they can be used as content for the generated mail.
    After this, the MailController is called to compose and send the conformation mail to the client. The configuration of the MailController must be contained inside the configuration of this Controller. The template, which is part of that configuration, will be used to compose the confirmation mail, where the confirmation link must be contained. The confirmation link has the structure:

    confirmationPage?"validationId"=ID
    The confirmation page can be any virtual page and must be defined as route for the PasswordLostController, so that it is reacting to it. The ID is the ID, which was stored before in the context.

    After successfully processing the MailController, the success page, defined by , is called. If anything failed, then the information about the error are stored under the parameter "resetError" inside the context and the error page defined by "pwLostFailUrl" is called.
    When a user clicks the link in the mail, the PasswordLostController will perform the confirmation. It will fetch the instance of PasswordLostClaim, which was previously created, will fetch the IAuthenticatable from the datastore and will store it under the property AUTHENTICATABLE_PROP . After that it will call the success page, defined by "pwResetSuccessUrl". If anything failed, then the information about the error are stored under the parameter "resetError" inside the contenxt and the error page defined by "pwResetFailUrl" is called.

    Config-Parameter:
    possible parameters, which are read from the configuration
    • "pwLostSuccessUrl"
    • "pwLostFailUrl"
    • "pwResetSuccessUrl"
    • "pwResetFailUrl"
    • "emailFieldName" - defines the name of the field, which transports the email address to be used for the reset process
    • Additionally the config-parameters of MailController must be set

    Request-Parameter:
    possible parameters, which are read from a request
    • email - defined by and used to transport the email address of the account to reset the password for
    • "validationId" - used for the confirmation to transport the id of the PasswordLostClaim created in the first step

    Result-Parameter:
    possible paramters, which will be placed into the context
    • "resetError" the parameter, where an error String of a failed registration is stored in the context. The codes are defined by RegistrationCode
    • if sending t√≥f the confirmation mail failed, it is stored under this property
    • "validationId" - on a successfull create action, the ID of PasswordLostClaim is stored here and the request is redirected to the success page, where the confirmation mail is created and sent. This parameter is keeping the confirmation id, which must be integrated into the link
    • PasswordLostClaim - on a successfull create action, the PasswordLostClaim is stored here

    Author:
    Michael Remme

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String AUTHENTICATABLE_CLASS_PROP
      The name of the class - as instance of IAuthenticatable - which will be used to save a successful and improved registration as Member for instance
      static java.lang.String AUTHENTICATABLE_PROP
      When the confirmation link was clicked, then the system fetches the instance of IAuthenticatable, like a Member, and stores it under this property into the context
      static java.lang.String EMAIL_FIELD_NAME_PROP
      This property defines the name of the parameter, by which the email address is transported, when the password lost process is started
      static java.lang.String PW_LOST_FAIL_URL_PROP
      The url, which shall be called, when the password lost process should be started, but failed
      static java.lang.String PW_LOST_SUCCESS_URL_PROP
      The url, which shall be called after the password lost process has been successfully started.
      static java.lang.String PW_RESET_FAIL_URL_PROP
      The url, which shall be called, if the PasswordLostClaim could not be successfully verified
      static java.lang.String PW_RESET_SUCCESS_URL_PROP
      The url, which shall be called, after the user clicked the link inside the password lost message, which was sent before, and after the PasswordLostClaim was successfully verified.
      static java.lang.String RESET_ERROR_PARAM
      The name of the parameter which is used to store error information in the context
      static java.lang.String VALIDATION_ID_PARAM
      The name of the parameter, which keeps the validation ID.
